passage: Value-added tax (VAT) is a consumption tax placed on a product whenever value is added at each stage of the supply chain, from production to the point of sale. The amount of VAT that the user pays is on the cost of the product, less any of the costs of materials used in the product that have already been taxed. VAT is used in more than 160 countries worldwide and has been adopted by all European Union countries as a source of revenue.
question: Which choice best states the main purpose of the text?

choices.A: To provide a general understanding of value-added tax and its prevalence in the global economy
choices.B: To argue that value-added tax should be implemented in all countries as a primary source of revenue
choices.C: To compare the advantages and disadvantages of value-added tax with other types of taxes
choices.D: To describe the specific process of calculating value-added tax for various types of products

explanation: A: 'To provide a general understanding of value-added tax and its prevalence in the global economy' is the correct answer because the text explains the basic concept of VAT, how it is applied, and mentions its widespread use in more than 160 countries, including all European Union countries.
distractor_explanation: 'To argue that value-added tax should be implemented in all countries as a primary source of revenue' is incorrect because the text does not present an argument for or against VAT.
'To compare the advantages and disadvantages of value-added tax with other types of taxes' is incorrect because the text does not discuss any comparisons with other tax systems.

'To describe the specific process of calculating value-added tax for various types of products' is incorrect because the text provides a general overview of VAT but does not delve into specific calculation methods for different products.
